translated: The Dhāraṇī of the Six-Faced One

original: oṃ namo buddhāya //🔽evaṃ mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye bhagavān śuddhāvāsoparigaganatalapratiṣṭhite saptaratna pravibha ktavicitraratnavyūhe mahāmaṇḍalamāḍe
analyzed: om namaḥ buddhāya  evam mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye bhagavān śuddhāvāsa upari gagana tala pratiṣṭhite sapta ratna pravibhakta vicitra ratna vyūhe mahā maṇḍalam āḍe

translated: Thus have I heard. At one time, the Blessed One was dwelling in the great maṇḍala palace of the seven precious substances, adorned with various jewels, situated in the sky above the Pure Abodes,
together with an innumerable assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: tatra khalu bhagavān bodhisattvān āmantrayate sma //
analyzed: tatra khalu bhagavān bodhisattvān āmantrayate sma
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the bodhisattvas:

original: udgṛhṇīdhavaṃ yūyaṃ kulaputrā imāṃ ṣaṇmukhīnāmadhāraṇīṃ sarvajagaddhitārthaṃ //
analyzed: udgṛhṇīdhavam yūyam kula putrāḥ imām ṣaṇmukhī nāmadhāraṇīm sarva jagat hita artham
translated: Take up, O sons of noble family, this dhāraṇī called 'Six-Faced,' for the benefit of all beings.

original: saṃsāre saṃsarato yo me kaścid duḥkhā nubhavaḥ sa mā bhūt sa rva samatā'pratisaṃvidita lakṣa ṇaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsāre saṃsarataḥ yaḥ me kaścid duḥkha anubhavaḥ sa mā bhūt
translated: May any painful experience I have while wandering in saṃsāra not be due to the realization of the equality of all things.

original: yaś ca me kaścil laukikasampattisukhānubhavaḥ sa bhavatu sarvasattvasādhāraṇapa ribhogaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca me kaścid laukika sampatti sukha anubhavaḥ sa bhavatu sarva sattva sādhāraṇa pa ribhogaḥ
translated: And may any worldly prosperity and happiness I experience be enjoyed in common with all beings.

original: yac ca me kiñcit pāpakarmākuśalamūlaṃ karmāvaraṇaṃ tan mā bhūd
analyzed: yat ca me kiñcid pāpa karma akuśala mūlam karma āvaraṇam tat mā bhūt
translated: And whatever evil deeds and roots of non-virtue I have, may they not be
concealed, but confessed with sincere regret.

original: yāni ca me mārakarmāṇi tāni mā bhūvann aparijñātāny anuttarayā parijñayā /
analyzed: yāni ca me māra karmāṇi tāni mā bhūvan a parijñātāni anuttarayā parijñayā
translated: And may those deeds of Māra be unknown to me through unsurpassed complete knowledge.

original: yac ca me kiñcit pāramitopasaṃhi taṃ kuśalamūlaṃ laukikalokottaraṃ vā tad bhavatu sarvasattvānām anuttarajñānaṃ /
analyzed: yat ca me kiñcid pāramitā upasaṃhi tam kuśala mūlam laukika lokottaram vā tat bhavatu sarva sattvānām anuttara jñānam
translated: And whatever roots of virtue I have accumulated through the perfections, whether worldly or transcendental, may they become the unsurpassed knowledge of all beings.

original: yā ca me vimuktiḥ sā bhavatu sarvasattvavimokṣāya /
analyzed: yā ca me vimuktiḥ sā bhavatu sarva sattva vimokṣāya
translated: And may my liberation be for the liberation of all beings.

original: mā ca me bhūt saṃsāre nirvāṇe pratiṣṭhitatā //
analyzed: mā ca me bhūt saṃsāre nirvāṇe pratiṣṭhita tā
translated: May I not abide in saṃsāra or nirvāṇa.

original: yaḥ kaścit kulapu tro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ ṣaṇmukhīnāmadhāraṇīṃ triṣkṛtvā rātres triṣkṛtvā divasya cānuvar t
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid kula pu traḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām ṣaṇmukhī nāmadhāraṇīm triṣkṛtvā rātreḥ triṣkṛtvā divasya
translated: If any son or daughter of good family would recite this six-faced dhāraṇī three times at night and three times during the day,

analyzed: tayiṣyati sa sarva karmāṇi kṣepayitvā kṣīpram
translated: having eliminated all karmic actions, he will quickly

analyzed: idam avoc bha gavān ātta manāḥ te ca bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan iti
translated: The Blessed One said this, and those bodhisattva mahāsattvas rejoiced and praised the Blessed One's words.
The noble six-faced dhāraṇī is completed.
